intro: Lastrea phacelothrix, commonly known as the red-stemmed sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are usually opposite and lance-shaped, with a hairy texture. The flowers are typically pink to red in color, adding ornamental value to its natural habitat.
